body_html:
The resize_bicubic kernel, for channels!=3 cases, has inner loops over channel and then width:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/kernels/resize_bicubic_op.cc
Probably we need to change this to do something different when there a large number of channels, perhaps taking the 3-channel logic and doing chunks of that size (or even 4-channel case).

There is a benchmark in tensorflow/core/kernels/resize_bicubic_op_test.cc where we can add a channels=40 case and test to improve its performance.

body:
The resize_bicubic kernel, for channels!=3 cases, has inner loops over channel and then width:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/kernels/resize_bicubic_op.cc
Probably we need to change this to do something different when there a large number of channels, perhaps taking the 3-channel logic and doing chunks of that size (or even 4-channel case).

There is a benchmark in tensorflow/core/kernels/resize_bicubic_op_test.cc where we can add a channels=40 case and test to improve its performance.
